article.headline: Davidson 100, Illinois-Chicago 89
article.story: DAVIDSON, N.C. (AP) -- Stephen Curry's game-high 27 points and nine rebounds helped push Davidson past Illinois-Chicago 100-89 on Wednesday to win its 15th-straight home opener. Thomas Sander added 23 points and eight rebounds for Davidson (3-1), which hit 70 percent of its second-half shots -- 80 percent outside the arc. Curry went 11-of-19 shooting and finished 3-of-6 on 3-pointers. William Archambault finished with 19 points and hit 6-of-8 shooting, including four of the Wildcats' dozen 3-pointers. Boris Meno added a career-high 17 points and seven rebounds. Josh Mayo lead Illinois-Chicago (1-1) with 26 points and four rebounds. T.J. Gray added 16 points and Jovan Stefanov finished with 14 points and a team-high six rebounds. The Wildcats overcame the Flames' 17-12 lead at 13:38 after with a 16-3 run, but Illinois-Chicago answered with a 10-2 streak. The teams were tied 39-39 at the half. Archambault hit a long-range shot with 4:08 left in the game, giving Davidson a 93-78 lead that would carry the Wildcats to victory.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
